alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 8:28PM CST until January 29 at 3:25PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Rises continues on the Sucarnoochee River and a flood warning remains in effect. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1130 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River at Livingston. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 15.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall to 15.6 feet early Saturday morning. It will rise above flood stage late Saturday morning to 19.5 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
